title.narrative: RIOS: Re-settlement Information and Observing System. A space solution to monitor informal settlements at risk and support re-settlement to safe areas.

description.narrative: RIOS uses earth observation coupled with environmental risk data to monitor informal settlements in Colombia. The project will help mitigate against the danger of loss of life arising from natural disasters in settlement areas and to support the re-housing of displaced people. Informal settlements in Colombia have grown in response to urbanisation and decades of conflict. This growth presents a major challenge in Colombia exacerbated by the natural hazards affecting these settlements. The Discovery Phase project undertaken in 2020-21 examined the technical feasibility of building a cloud-based platform to provide an operational monitoring capability to the Government and local municipalities in Colombia.

RIOS will focus on assessing the suitability of EO to provide a monitoring service for managing informal settlements in Colombia. The project will help mitigate against the danger of loss of life arising from natural disasters in settlement areas and to support the re-housing of displaced people. Informal settlements in Colombia have grown in response to urbanisation and decades of conflict. This growth presents a major challenge in Colombia exacerbated by the natural hazards affecting these settlements. The government requires a near real-time monitoring system, together with robust governance strategies that prevents the re-settlement of people in areas at risk. RIOS offers a cost-effective solution to address this challenge.
